resources.string: Have you been experiencing symptoms such as fatigue,dramatic weight changes,dry skin,brittle hair,muscle aches or sensitivity to cold temperatures?
Have you been experiencing these symptoms over an extended period of time?
Is there any hereditary history of hypothyroidism?
Do you have an auto-immune disorder such as type-1 diabetes or rheumatoid arthritis?
Are you undergoing anti-thyroid medication or have undergone a thyroid surgery?

Hypothyroidism, also called underactive thyroid or low thyroid, is a disorder of the endocrine system in which the thyroid gland does not produce enough thyroid hormone.It can cause a number of symptoms, such as poor ability to tolerate cold, a feeling of tiredness, constipation, depression, and weight gain. Occasionally there may be swelling of the front part of the neck due to goiter.
